results.title: Statins and tendinopathy: a systematic review.
results.text_hl: There was evidence that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduces the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Tendinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052256 @@@tendinopathy@@@.

results.title: Prevention of Simvastatin-Induced Inhibition of Tendon Cell Proliferation and Cell Cycle Progression by Geranylgeranyl Pyrophosphate.
results.text_hl: The present study demonstrated, for the first time, the molecular mechanism underlying @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Tendinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052256 @@@tendinopathy@@@ or @DISEASE_Rupture @DISEASE_MESH:D012421 @@@tendon rupture@@@.

results.title: Tendinous disorders attributed to statins: a study on ninety-six spontaneous reports in the period 1990-2005 and review of the literature.
authors: Network of the French Pharmacovigilance Centers
results.text_hl: Currently, however, statin-associated @<m>DISEASE_Tendinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052256 @@@tendon impairment@@@ has only been described anecdotally.

results.title: Cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis: a family study of sterol 27-hydroxylase mutations and pharmacotherapy.
results.text_hl: After 1 year there was significant improvement in both cognitive and motor function with regression of @<m>DISEASE_Tendinopathy</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052256 @@@tendon xanthomata@@@ on computerized tomography.

results.title: Nail-patella syndrome with an emphasis on the risk of renal and ocular findings.
